text:
The Great Apple Silicon Party is finally upon us (gasp!).  I can build Julia and try to install packages and it all works…. except for the fact that very, very few JLLs are actually built for Apple Silicon.  It’s time to figure out how to build things for apple silicon by default.

The only complicating factor is that any JLL that supports apple silicon will need to be Julia 1.6+, since it generates `Artifacts.toml` files that are illegal.  Absent a clever workaround for that issue, I think the best path forward is as follows:

* Change `supported_platforms()` in BB to include `armv6l` and `aarch64-darwin` in the list by default.
* Set BB to default `julia_compat` to `1.6+`.
* Rebuild a lot of stuff
